title: Check if the Sentence Is Pangram
description: A pangram is a sentence that contains every letter of the alphabet at least once. Given a string `sentence`, check if it is a pangram. Return `true` if it is a pangram, and `false` otherwise.
input_format: A string `sentence` consisting of uppercase and lowercase English letters, spaces, and punctuation.
output_format: A boolean value indicating whether the sentence is a pangram or not.

examples.input: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog
examples.explanation: This sentence contains every letter of the English alphabet at least once.
This sentence does not contain all letters of the alphabet.

hints: Consider using a set to track letters you've seen.
You may convert the string to lowercase to simplify comparisons.

title: Check Whether Two Strings are Almost Equivalent
description: Given two strings `s1` and `s2`, determine if they are almost equivalent. Two strings are considered almost equivalent if they can be made the same by changing at most one character in either string.
input_format: Two strings s1 and s2, both consisting of lowercase English letters.
output_format: Return a boolean value indicating whether the two strings are almost equivalent.
constraints: s1 and s2 consist only of lowercase English letters.

examples.explanation: By changing the last character 'c' in 'abc' to 'd', both strings become 'abd'.
Both strings are identical, thus they are considered as almost equivalent.
Changing one character cannot make 'abc' equal to 'def'.

hints: Count the number of differing characters between both strings.
If the count of differing characters is 0 or 1, they are almost equivalent.
